body.p: For dataset A, the mean and median are 68. Looking at dataset B, notice that all of the observations except the last one are close together. Which measure will be affected by this last observation in dataset B?

response.feedback: Correct. The mean will be affected by the outlier value 720.
Incorrect. The median will not be affected by the outlier value 720.

body.p: Here are the number of hours that 9 students spend on the computer on a typical day:
Which of the following represents the mean number of hours spent on the computer?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This value represents the mode, or the most frequently occurring number. The mean is the sum of all the observations divided by the total number of observations.
Incorrect. This value represents the median, the middle value in an ordered data set. The mean is the sum of all the observations divided by the total number of observations.
Correct. The mean involves the sum of all the observations (1 + 6 + 7 + 6 + 6 + 11 + 6 + 12 + 15 = 72) divided by the total number of observations (9), which equals 8.0.
Incorrect. This is the total number of observations. The mean is the sum of all the observations divided by the total number of observations.
